timeline.bodyText: This comment is a bit confusing... It should describe what the method does. What does it allow?
timeline.author: Runemoro
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -7,6 +7,18 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_2246 net/minecraft/block/Blocks
 	METHOD method_26110 createShulkerBoxBlock (Lnet/minecraft/class_1767;Lnet/minecraft/class_4970$class_2251;)Lnet/minecraft/class_2480;
 		ARG 0 color
 		ARG 1 settings
+	METHOD method_26113 allow (Lnet/minecraft/class_2680;Lnet/minecraft/class_1922;Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;)Z
+		COMMENT A shortcut to allow in a context predicate, used as {@code Blocks::allow}.

replies.bodyText: It is passed to settings, like blockVision(Blocks::allow)
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Hmm, should prob rename them to always/never
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: I see, so these just always return true/false?
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: Yeah, always and never would be better. allow sounds more like a method that adds something to a list of allowed things, than just returning true.
replies.author: Runemoro

timeline.message:
Better document these 4 things

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>
